private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Cooperate with agent_2 to reach the target peg configuration.

private_information: I can move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Cooperate with agent_1 to reach the target peg configuration.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move proposals and produce a valid PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that accomplishes the global goal.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Initial stack: left peg has all disks from top (A) to bottom (O); middle and right are empty.
Goal stacks: left top->bottom B,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle top->bottom C,E; right top->bottom A,D.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 can move only disks A..H; agent_2 can move only disks I..O.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move only disks A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H and must obey Tower of Hanoi rules. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves to contribute toward the global goal. Each move must be exactly in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not produce PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide a safe, step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk-moving restrictions. Do not assume the other agent's intentions beyond their private information.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move only disks I,J,K,L,M,N,O and must obey Tower of Hanoi rules. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves to contribute toward the global goal. Each move must be exactly in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not produce PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide a safe, step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk-moving restrictions. Do not assume the other agent's intentions beyond their private information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling targeting the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the proposed primitive moves from the agents, produce a consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the two agents (keep their actions distinct as agent1-move and agent2-move), ensures Tower of Hanoi constraints, and achieves the stated goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should be immediately usable by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the move lists from both agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Agents' private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} ; {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the agents' move proposals, resolve any naming or ordering ambiguities, and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownwards. Keep actions distinct so that moves performed by agent_1 use action names reflecting agent_1 and moves by agent_2 reflect agent_2. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If you need to modify or add intermediate moves to ensure legality under Tower of Hanoi rules, do so and document them in the produced PDDL problem initial state or plan comments.
